STEVENS.EDUSearch

Essential Insights for Engineering Management

Engineering Management is a complex and challenging field requiring unique skills and knowledge. Our Engineering Essentials articles provide valuable resources for professionals looking to develop their leadership and management skills in this industry.

In these articles, you will find a range of essential insights and strategies for managing complex engineering projects, building high-performing teams and developing innovative solutions. Whether you are a seasoned engineering manager or in the early stages of your career, our Engineering Essentials resources have something for everyone.

Categories:

The Rise of Artificial Intelligence and Innovation in Engineering Management

August 5, 2024

By Stevens Online

Artificial intelligence has made its presence felt across countless industries and professions, with engineering management close to the epicenter. Companies leverage data to make important decisions about resources, risk, and recruiting; AI has made that process more powerful and more fraught with potential complications for engineering managers.

When is the Best Time to Earn Your Master’s in Engineering Management Degree?

August 12, 2024

By Stevens Online

Demand for engineering managers grows across healthcare, technology, construction, manufacturing and other industries. If you plan to pursue an engineering management career, an advanced degree – such as a master’s in engineering management – can provide a pathway to reaching your goals.

Engineering Management Degree: A Guide to Getting Into a Top Master’s Program

April 21, 2022

By Stevens Online

Engineers are behind many of history’s most significant innovations. From developing safer automobiles to perfecting the first spacecraft, engineers have toiled away behind the scenes doing the creative thinking, designing and building that allowed humanity to reach its loftiest goals, with the help of an engineering management degree.

Engineering Manager or Tech Lead: Choosing Your Path

September 24, 2023

By Stevens Online

Engineering manager and tech lead sound like similar titles, but they are two very different roles. While they work together closely to reach shared goals, their roles and responsibilities have minimal overlap. Understanding the difference between the two is critical in deciding if an engineering management degree is right for your professional goals.

Engineering Manager Salary Guide: What to Expect and How to Advance

June 24, 2024

By Stevens Online

Engineering managers are crucial in ensuring projects conclude on time, within budget and in line with the required quality standards. They work in various industries, from construction and manufacturing to technology and renewable energy. As these industries grow, the need for leaders to manage projects and staff increases to keep operations running smoothly.

Engineering Technology: The Benefits of Choosing a Technology-Focused Master’s Program

December 12, 2022

By Stevens Online

Successful engineering managers view projects in several ways. “When engineering management is done right, you’re focusing on three big things,” Jessica MacKellar, founder and CTO of Pilot, told First Round Review. “You’re directly supporting the people on your team; you’re managing execution and coordination across teams; and you’re stepping back to observe and evolve the broader organization and its processes as it grows all with the high in demand skill of engineering technology management.”

Finding Success in Engineering Leadership

November 2, 2023

By Stevens Online

Understanding the difference between management roles is essential in determining how to plot the course of your career. The right graduate degree program for you depends on your strengths, passions, knowledge and skills. Two common engineering leadership roles are tech leads and engineering managers. Identifying which position best aligns with you can greatly affect professional satisfaction and upward mobility.

From Engineering Manager Program to Hands-On Leader

September 24, 2023

By Stevens Online

Is an engineering management program for you? You wouldn’t be reading this if you haven’t already asked yourself that question. This crossroad is an exciting point in your career as you explore opportunities in management and software engineering manager programs.Navigating more senior roles like an engineering manager, you may find you need to pursue a program more than an undergraduate degree. Deciding if pursuing a program that focuses on management is right for you is an important next step. The alternative would be enrolling in a program aimed at strengthening skills in computer science, systems engineering or web development.
